column4: Pls how can I know the exact block that represent a byte or kb for the -size in 'find' command
Pls how can I know the exact block to represent 10kb for the -size in 'find' command
I guess noone's got a clue about my quest
you can only have 4 primary partitions, if you have windows then you only need the one ntfs for windows, the rest could be logical partitions
wubi is awful, it isn't meant to be used as a long term solution, it is more of a try before you dive in deal
even then a vm would be better than wubi
what of my installed apps? I have so much pimped my present ubuntu
what unknown partitions, they are all ntfs
you'd need to delete the partitions you don't need/want
seriously, back up what you need first
you need to figure out what partition has what on it and back up what you need
